segment.documentation: BGM, A segment identifying the declaration type and reference.
CST, A segment identifying the customs procedure and status of the goods relevant to the whole message.
LOC, A segment identifying a place or location relevant to the entire message. For example, port of loading, office of entry, etc.
DTM, A segment identifying dates, times or periods relevant to the whole message. For example, actual date of arrival, elected date of presentation, etc.
GIS, A segment identifying the various indicators required by a customs system. For example, special programs, release certification, duty free eligibility under GSP, etc.
FII, A segment identifying an account and a related financial institution relevant to the whole message.
MEA, A segment identifying various measurement factors where these are required for the whole declaration (message).
EQD, A segment identifying the equipment (e.g. container id.) used to transport all the goods related to the whole declaration (message).
SEL, A segment identifying Customs seals used in the transport of goods related to the whole declaration (message).
FTX, A segment explaining the reasons or actions undertaken in processing a message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments identifying various references, manifest quantities and package identities relevant to the whole message.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the various references relevant to the whole message.
DTM, A segment identifying a date related to the previous RFF segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segment identifying the numbers of, the types of, and the markings individual packages.

segment.documentation: PAC, A segment identifying the number and type of packages manifested on a bill of lading, warehouse entry, etc.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments identifying markings and labels on manifested units.

segment.documentation: PCI, A segment identifying markings and labels on individual manifested units.
FTX, A segment describing the goods identified in PCI in narrative form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments identifying the mode, means and identification of the transport used.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment identifying the mode and means of transport used.
TPL, A segment identifying the transport vehicle used.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments identifying documentary requirements where they are needed as supporting information for the entire message.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying a specific document required as supporting information for the entire message.
DTM, A segment identifying dates related to the document identified in DOC.
LOC, A segment identifying a location related to the document identified in DOC.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments identifying the parties relevant to the whole message, with their related references, contacts, and communication numbers.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying the parties relevant to the entire message. For example importer, ultimate consignee, etc.
RFF, A segment identifying references relating to the party specified within the group. For example, a special mailing request number for refunds relating to the customs transaction.
CTA, A segment identifying a contact person(s) or department(s) associated with the party specified in this group.
COM, A segment identifying the phone number, fax number or other communications number of the party and (or) contact specified within this group.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments identifying the terms of delivery pertinent to the entire message.

segment.documentation: TOD, A segment identifying terms of delivery, relevant to the entire message, in a coded format.
LOC, A segment identifying a location related to the terms of delivery identified in TOD.
FTX, A segment identifying the terms of delivery in narrative form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments identifying monetary amounts, currencies and their exchange rates, when required for the whole declaration.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying a monetary function and up to five monetary amounts.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments identifying currencies, a rate of exchange and a related date for a monetary amount identified within this group.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying currencies and the rate of exchange for a monetary amount identified within this group.
DTM, A segment identifying a date related to the information contained in the CUX. 4.1.2 Detail section Information to be provided in the Detail section:
UNS, A service segment placed at the beginning of the detail section to indicate the beginning of that section.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: SG21 A group of segments identifying line item details for a commercial document.

segment.documentation: DMS, A segment identifying the commercial document number, the document type and the number of detail lines within the document heading this group.
DTM, A segment identifying a date related to the commercial document identified in DMS.
MEA, A segment providing measurements values for the whole commercial document where required by an administration.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments identifying various monetary amounts, currencies and rates of exchange that pertain to the whole commercial document.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying a monetary amount related to the whole commercial document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments identifying currencies, rate of exchange and an associated date.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying currency details and a rate of exchange related to the preceding MOA.
DTM, The effective date of the rate of exchange reported in this group.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments identifying the terms of delivery pertinent to the whole commercial document.

segment.documentation: TOD, A segment identifying, in a coded format, the terms of delivery relevant to the entire document.
LOC, A segment identifying a location related to the information contained in the TOD.
FTX, A segment identifying the terms of delivery in narrative form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments identifying the parties and other related documentary requirements associated with the whole commercial document.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying the parties and addresses relevant to the whole commercial document. For example, manufacturer, invoicer, buyer, etc.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A segment identifying other documentary requirements associated with a party identified in the preceding NAD segment. For example, purchase order, contract number, etc.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying documents associated with the party identified in the preceding NAD.
DTM, A segment identifying a date associated with the information contained in DOC.
LOC, A segment identifying a location related to the preceding DOC.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments identifying the number, type, and contents of the shipping units associated with the entire commercial document.

segment.documentation: PAC, A segment identifying the number and type of shipping units covered by the whole document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments identifying marks and labels of shipping units associated with the whole commercial document.

segment.documentation: PCI, A segment identifying marks and labels on specific shipping units covered by the entire document.
FTX, A segment describing the goods identified in PCI in narrative form.
RFF, A segment identifying a reference associated with the information contained in PCI.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments identifying the payment terms for the whole commercial document.

segment.documentation: PAT, A segment identifying the payment terms in coded format for the whole commercial document.
MOA, A segment identifying a monetary amount associated with the preceding PAT.
PCD, A segment identifying percentage details associated with the preceding PAT.
FTX, A segment identifying the payment terms in a narrative form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments identifying allowances, charges, or adjustments and related details for the whole commercial document.

segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying allowances, charges and adjustments related to the whole commercial document.
RTE, A segment identifying rate information related to the preceding ALC.
MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount associated with the ALC.
PCD, A segment identifying percentage information associated with the ALC.
QTY, A segment identifying a quantity associated with the ALC.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments identifying currencies, a rate of exchange, and an associated date for an allowance, charge or adjustment reported in the preceding ALC segment.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying currency details and a rate of exchange related to the preceding MOA.
DTM, A segment identifying a date associated with the preceding CUX.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: SG22-SG23-SG25-SG26-SG27-SG28 A group of segments identifying line item details for a commercial document.

segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the line item number and the item number identification of a particular commercial document line.
PIA, A segment identifying additional or substitutional item identification codes related to the information in LIN.
QTY, A segment identifying a specific quantity related to information in LIN.
PRI, A segment identifying price information for a particular line item identified in LIN.
PCD, A segment identifying percentage information for a particular line item identified in LIN.
MEA, A segment identifying secondary quantity information where more than one quantity is required to be reported for a commercial document line.
QVR, A segment identifying the quantity difference an the reason for this difference between the commercial document line and the actual line item.
MOA, A segment identifying monetary amounts required by customs, but not otherwise captured by the commercial document line value.
NAD, A segment identifying the parties and addresses relevant to a particular commercial document line. For example, manufacturer, ultimate consignee etc.
GIR, A segment identifying a serial numbers or other related numbers associated with the merchandise on a specific commercial document line.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments identifying customs documentary requirements for a commercial document line item. For example, an import or export license.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying a specific customs documentary requirement for a commercial line item.
DTM, A segment identifying dates related to the preceding DOC.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A group of segments identifying allowances, charges, or adjustments and related details for the commercial document line.

segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying allowances, charges or adjustments specific to a commercial document line.
RTE, A segment identifying rate information related to the preceding ALC.
MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount associated with the preceding ALC.
PCD, A segment identifying percentage information associated with the preceding ALC.
QTY, A segment identifying a quantity associated with the preceding ALC.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments identifying currencies, rates of exchange and associated dates for an allowance, charge, or adjustment reported in the preceding ALC.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying currencies and the rate of exchange for an allowance, charge, or adjustment reported in the preceding ALC segment.
DTM, A segment identifying a specific date related to CUX.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 25: A group of segments identifying the terms of delivery pertinent to a commercial document line.

segment.documentation: TOD, A segment identifying, in coded format, the terms of delivery particular to a commercial document line.
LOC, A segment identifying a location related to the information contained in the preceding TOD segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 26: A group of segments identifying the payment terms for a commercial document line.

segment.documentation: PAT, A segment identifying the terms of payment, in a coded format, for a particular commercial document line.
MOA, A segment identifying a monetary amount associated with the preceding PAT.
PCD, A segment identifying percentage details associated with the preceding PAT.
FTX, A segment starting the terms of payment in narrative form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 27: A group of segments identifying a commercial description for a documented commodity that is associated with this Customs, item line.

segment.documentation: IMD, A segment identifying a documented item via an industry coded format, or a restricted narrative.
FTX, A segment identifying the item description in extended narrative form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 28: A group of segments identifying the number, type, contents and description of the packing units associated with the commercial document line.

segment.documentation: PAC, A segment identifying the number and type of packing units particular to a document line.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 29: A group of segments identifying marks, labels and description of packages relating to a document line.

segment.documentation: PCI, A segment identifying a particular package associated with the preceding PAC.
FTX, A segment identifying a particular packing unit, associated with the preceding PCI, in narrative form.
RFF, A segment identifying a reference related to the preceding PCI.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 30: SG37-SG38-SG39-SG40-SG41-SG42-SG44 A group of segments identifying detailed information for a single customs item of a customs declaration.

segment.documentation: CST, A segment identifying the customs tariff of the goods, their required treatment and, where these are different to the header information, the type of declaration and the current status of the goods.
FTX, A segment identifying the goods, related to the preceding
LOC, A segment identifying the places relevant to a customs item. For example, country of origin, country of export, etc.
DTM, A segment identifying dates particular to the customs item. For example, date of original exportation.
MEA, A segment identifying the necessary statistical information requirements related to a tariff number. For example, net weights, volumes, etc.
NAD, A segment identifying a party particular to the customs item when required by customs. For example, manufacturer of the goods.
TDT, A segment identifying transport details, for statistical purposes, on goods crossing statistical boundaries.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 31: A group of segments identifying the number, type and reference of the packing units associated with the customs item.

segment.documentation: PAC, A segment identifying the number and type of packages relating to the customs item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 32: A group of segments identifying marks and labels, and giving the description of single packages associated with a customs item.

segment.documentation: PCI, A segment identifying markings and labels on the type of packages reported in the preceding PAC.
FTX, A segment describing the goods identified in PCI in narrative form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 33: A group of segments identifying various monetary amounts, currencies and rates of exchange that pertain to the customs item.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amounts necessary for statistical and duty purposes.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 34: A group of segments identifying currencies, a rate of exchange and an associated date related to the preceding MOA.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying currencies and the rate of exchange for an amount reported in the preceding MOA.
DTM, A segment identifying a date related to the preceding CUX.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 35: A group of segments identifying references, descriptions, and monetary amounts associated with a customs item.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying particular references relating to the customs item. For example, the invoice number of any invoice that contains merchandise on this customs item.
DTM, A segment identifying a date associated with the preceding RFF.
GIN, A segment identifying any line or range of lines on the commercial document reported in the preceding RFF segment, that contains goods on this customs item.
MOA, A segment identifying commercial document line monetary amounts where the Commercial Group is not offered but an administration requires this information.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 36: A group of segments identifying a commercial description for a documented commodity that is associated with this customs line item.

segment.documentation: IMD, A segment identifying the coded industry description of the merchandise on the document line(s) identified in the preceding GIN segment.
FTX, A segment identifying the documented merchandise in narrative form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 37: A group of segments identifying report documentary requirements of particular government agencies, with the optional name and address of the agency involved.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying a document related to a customs item.
DTM, A segment identifying dates associated with the preceding DOC.
LOC, A segment identifying a location associated with the preceding DOC.
NAD, A segment identifying the identity and address of the agency related to the documentary requirement.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 38: A group of segments identifying the terms of delivery pertinent to a customs item.

segment.documentation: TOD, A segment identifying, in coded format, the terms of delivery of the entered goods, where these are specific to the customs item.
LOC, A segment identifying the place of delivery associated with the preceding TOD.
FTX, A segment identifying the terms of delivery in narrative form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 39: A group of segments identifying the customs description of merchandise entered on a customs item.

segment.documentation: GDS, A segment identifying a customs description, in coded format, of the goods declared on the customs item.
FTX, A segment identifying the customs description in narrative form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 40: A group of segments identifying special indicators or value data related to the customs item.

segment.documentation: GIS, A segment identifying any necessary processing indicators where these are required by customs at the item level.
PCD, A segment identifying percentage details related to adjustments where a relationship is identified between the buyer and seller.
DTM, A segment identifying a date related the preceding GIS.
RFF, A segment identifying a reference related to the preceding GIS.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 41: A group of segments identifying duties/taxes/fees and methods of payment related to a customs item.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment identifying the tax type, rate and base associated with a customs item.
MOA, A segment identifying monetary amounts (e.g. tax/fee amount) associated with the preceding TAX.
GIS, A segment identifying an indicator (e.g. method payment indicator) associated with the preceding TAX.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 42: A group of segments identifying variances between the quantity commercially documented and/or produced to Customs and the quantity declared.

segment.documentation: QVR, A segment identifying quantity difference and the reason for the difference between the declared and commercially documented amounts.
QTY, A segment identifying the quantity related to the preceding QVR.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 43: A group of segments identifying an earlier customs declaration in order to balance the total quantity declared with the total quantity presented to Customs.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying a reference to a previous customs declaration.
DTM, A segment identifying a date associated with the preceding RFF.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 44: A group of segments identifying customs reporting requirements associated with a secondary tariff number.

segment.documentation: GIR, A segment identifying the tariff number where the published tariff requires more than one tariff number.
GIS, A segment identifying any necessary processing indicators related to the tariff number in the preceding GIR segment, where these are required by customs.
NAD, A segment identifying a party particular to the goods governed by the tariff number in the preceding GIR segment. For example, manufacturer of the goods.
MEA, A segment identifying the necessary statistical information requirements related to the tariff number in the GIR segment. For example, net weight, volume, etc.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 45: A group of segments identifying various monetary amounts, currencies and rates of exchange that pertain to a secondary tariff number within a customs item.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount necessary for statistical and/or duty purposes, as it relates to the tariff number in the preceding GIR segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 46: A group of segments identifying currencies, a rate of exchange and related date for an amount reported in the preceding MOA.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying currencies and the rate of exchange for an amount reported in the preceding MOA segment.
DTM, A segment identifying a date related to the preceding CUX.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 47: A group of segments identifying the duties, taxes, and/or fees pertinent to the tariff number reported in the GIR segment.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment identifying the tax type, rate and base associated with the preceding GIR.
MOA, A segment identifying monetary amounts (e.g. tax/fee amount) associated with the preceding TAX.
GIS, A segment identifying an indicator associated with the preceding TAX, (e.g. method of payment indicator).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 48: A group of segments identifying specific documentary information which may be required by the tariff number in the GIR segment. For example, a textile category number.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying a specific document related to the preceding GIR.
DTM, A segment identifying a date associated with the preceding DOC.
LOC, A segment identifying a place associated with the preceding DOC. 4.1.3 Summary section Information to be provided in the Summary section:
UNS, A service segment placed at the beginning of the summary section to indicate the start of that section.
CNT, A segment specifying control totals. For example, the number of commercial documents, the total number of customs item, values, and packages reported in the message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 49: A segment identifying the totals and duty/tax/fee levels due for the declaration and summarizing this total by each accounting code included in the total due.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment identifying the summary tax type, rates and base for a full declaration.
MOA, A segment identifying amounts associated with the preceding TAX (e.g. total amounts for each duty/tax/fee).
GIS, A segment identifying an indicator related to the preceding TAX (e.g. summary method of payment).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 50: A group of segments permitting the verification of the authenticity of the sender and the integrity of the data.

segment.documentation: AUT, A segment containing the result of the algorithm permitting the verification of the authenticity of the sender and the integrity of the data.
DTM, A segment identifying a date associated with the preceding AUT.
